20021-d-03-19-02-APA.Narrative: THE APACHE RAILWAY'S BRAKEMAN ALIGNED THE SWITCH FROM 8532 CROSSOVER TO MOVE TO 8531 TO COUPLE TO COAL TONNAGE.  THE BRAKEMAN INSPECTED THE SWITCHPOINT ON THE CROSSOVER ON THE 8531 END WHICH WAS ALREADY ALIGNED TO 8532.  THE SWITCHPOINT WAS NOT OPEN.  THE APACHE RAILWAY CREW THEN MOVED BACK TO 8532AND PICKED UP APPROXIMATELY 34 REGULAR LOADS (THE ONLY SWITCH THAT HAD TO BE REALIGNED IN THIS MOVEMENT WAS THE 8532 SWITCH).  THEY THEN SWITCHED BACK TO 8531 AND COUPLED TO SEVENTEEN (17) COAL CARS AND SWITCHED THEM OVER TO 8532 THEN SWITCHED BACK TO 8531 (THE ONLY SWITCH THAT HAD TO BE REALIGNED IN THESE MOVEMENTS WAS THE 8532 SWITCH).  THE APACHE RAILWAY CREW THEN DEPARTED FROM 8531 WITH 34 MIXED FREIGHT AND 30 COAL CARS WITH 5 4AXLE LOCOMOTIVES AT HIGH SPEED OF 9MPH WHEN THE 56TH CAR IN THETRAIN PICKED UP THE NORTH SWITCHPOINT ON THE CROSSOVER SWITCH ON 8531 ON ACCOUNT SWITCHPOINT WAS INIMPROPER REPAIR RESULTING IN A DERAILMENT OF 5 COAL CARS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
